main event: An unidentified flying object was spotted in Northern California and Southern Oregon on July 3, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared to be well-defined, oval in shape, and white to slightly yellow in color, with a few small lights that seemed to be part of the object.
The object moved from the northwest to the southeast at an apparent speed of 3 to 5 degrees per second, dipped slightly below the horizon, and became obscured by trees.
The witness was a reliable observer with 6 years of experience, and his description of the object's characteristics and movement is consistent with an astronomical object or aircraft.
The object was concluded to possibly be an aircraft or a balloon, or an astronomical phenomenon.
The sighting was reported to have occurred in multiple locations in Northern California and Southern Oregon.
sighted object: An oval-shaped, white to slightly yellow object with small lights
